Posts.EditableText: Is the Wiki in a menu somewhere? It is impossible(almost) to find.
Posts.HTML: Is the Wiki in a menu somewhere? It is impossible(almost) to find.

Posts.EditableText: Do you mean the Quest documentation wiki? That was replaced by this site: http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/ You can find a link to that in the footer of all pages at textadventures.co.uk. It's no longer a wiki - it uses GitHub pages instead, so contributions are accepted via pull requests now (the same as the Quest source code). Source is at https://github.com/textadventures/quest/tree/gh-pages.
Posts.HTML:
Do you mean the Quest documentation wiki? That was replaced by this site: http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/

You can find a link to that in the footer of all pages at textadventures.co.uk. It's no longer a wiki - it uses GitHub pages instead, so contributions are accepted via pull requests now (the same as the Quest source code). Source is at https://github.com/textadventures/quest/tree/gh-pages.

Posts.EditableText: I was looking for the guide for using LevelLib.aslx. It is not in the list of libraries here in the forum. I see posts on how to install it into a game but how is it activated during gameplay or in other words, what code is used in script to raise levels by using points.
Posts.HTML: I was looking for the guide for using LevelLib.aslx. It is not in the list of libraries here in the forum. I see posts on how to install it into a game but how is it activated during gameplay or in other words, what code is used in script to raise levels by using points.

Posts.EditableText: here you go Forgewright: viewtopic.php?f=18&t=4057 (it's on the 2nd page of the 'library and code samples' forum-board (under the title of 'letting the player set attributes', which is a bit misleading/non-suspicious/aspicious?) it's some very creative/advanced/fancy use of Command parsing done by Pixie and Jay
